intro: Ceropegia africana, commonly known as the African basket flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing vines and tuberous roots. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia africana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
